H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1413.def: = causative action by which humans inflict wounds on their body with a knife, ► as a sign of mourning, or in order to reinforce one's prayer

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H7144.def: = a hairless patch on the head of an animal or human being in a location where hair normally grows; ≈ this can be a natural phenomenon, as on the head of a vulture, but it can also be created by shaving the head as a sign of mourning

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7716.def: = an individual member of a group of {L:sheep<SDBH:כֶּבֶשׂ>} and {L:goats<SDBH:עֵז>} traveling and feeding together

H3775.def: = young of a sheep, either male or female; ► clean animal, and allowed for food; also used for sacrifice

H5795.def: = a fairly small, female domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and relatively short hair, and usually found in one single {L:flock<SDBH:צֹאן>} with sheep; ► raised for its milk, meat, and skin; a clean animal and therefore to be eaten

H354.def: = wild animal, standing about a meter high, that ruminates, and of which the male grows antlers, which are dropped every year; has a reddish fur with white spots during summer; during winter the white spots disappear and the coat becomes darker; ◄ belongs to family of cervidae; ► clean animal and can therefore be eaten; ≈ associated with strength, speed, and agility; the male is also associated with sexual prowess

H3180.def: = a large antelope that is about 1.5 meters (5 feet) high at the shoulder, with a long face with a large lump on the head from which short thick horns sprout; it is reddish brown in color; lives on plains and grazes in herds; it can run fast; ► a clean animal that people were allowed to eat

H689.def: = fairly large wild goat, with adults being about ninety centimeters high at the shoulder; for most of the year its color is grayish but it turns browner in winter; males have thick long horns over 130 centimeters in length which curve backwards in a semicircle; the horns of the females are much slimmer and shorter, reaching a length of only about 40 centimeters; only the last few centimeters of the horns are smooth, the rest being ringed with ridges; these animals live in small herds in the mountains and prefer cliffs and crags, where they live off the bushes that grow on the ledges; ► clean animal, that may be eaten

H1788.def: = deerlike ruminant mammal of the Kobus family, of which the male grows two horns; feeds on plants; ◄ |iAddax nasomaculatus, Kobus|i*; ► clean animal which may be eaten

H8377.def: = medium-sized antelope, about the size of a donkey, with long slender horns that are usually over a meter long; these horns are almost straight and slope back from the animal’s head at about thirty degrees from the perpendicular; the adults are a light fawn color with dark brown markings on the face and on the lower part of both front and back legs; the belly is white; ◄ Oryx leucoryx; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H2169.def: exact meaning unknown; probably: = wild sheep, wild goat or deer; ► clean and can therefore be eaten

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H1625.def: =  the portion of food that is brought up into the mouth by ruminating animals from their first stomach to be chewed a second time

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H1625.def: =  the portion of food that is brought up into the mouth by ruminating animals from their first stomach to be chewed a second time

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H1581.def: = large quadruped mammal, which may reach a height of 2 m. or more; dromedaries are bigger and a uniform light fawn color; bactrians are darker; they are suited to life in desert areas, store excess food in their humps, can go without water for long periods, and can make long journeys through dry areas; ◄ Camelus dromedarius and Camelus bactrianus; ► they are used for riding and for carrying heavy loads and pulling carts; their hair is woven into cloth used for making tents or outer robes; their milk is used as food and drink; ≈ they are a symbol of wealth and commerce, but unclean and not to be eaten

H768.def: = relatively small, light brown animal about half a meter (20 inches) long, with long ears and a short fluffy tail; it has long hind legs and is a good jumper; it hides during the day and comes out to feed on vegetation at night; ► unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten

H8227.def: = Syrian Rock Hyrax; animal with small round ears, no visible tail, and short legs, lives on leaves and herbs; two of their front teeth develop into small tusks; can run up almost vertical rock faces and climb trees with ease; ◄ procavia capensis syriaca; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with small size and wisdom

H2931.def: = state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2386.def: = hairy mammal with hoofs, brown or gray in color; non-ruminant and omnivorous; ◄ |iSus scropus|i*, wild or domesticated land animal; ► unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ regarded as an ugly, filthy, and destructive animal and often associated with pagan rituals

H1625.def: =  the portion of food that is brought up into the mouth by ruminating animals from their first stomach to be chewed a second time

H2931.def: = state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H5038.def: = the dead body of humans or animals

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H5579.def: = appendage on the body of a fish or other aquatic animal, ► used for propelling, steering, and balancing

H7193.def: = small overlapping plates covering the body of a fish

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5579.def: = appendage on the body of a fish or other aquatic animal, ► used for propelling, steering, and balancing

H7193.def: = small overlapping plates covering the body of a fish

H2931.def: = state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H2889.def: = state in which an object is free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present

H6833.def: = small bird, speckled brown in color; found in abundance around towns and settlements; lives on grass and grain; ◄ Passer domesticus, Passer hispaniolensis, and Passer moabiticus; ► clean and can therefore be eaten

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H5404.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle

H6538.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of eagles and vultures of a slightly smaller size than the {L:נֶשֶׁר<SDBH:נֶשֶׁר>}; including: the Gypaëtus barbatus (Bearded vulture or Lammergeier), the Circaetus gallicus (alternatively Circaetus pectoralus: the Black-breasted Snake Eagle, the Short-toed Eagle, the Black-chested Harrier Eagle), and the Hieraeetus pennatus (Booted Eagle), as well as one or two others

H5822.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = relatively small type of vulture; ◄ Aegypius monachus; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H7201.def: = bird of prey, dark brown with a greyish head and a long V-shaped tail, flies relatively low and slowly; feeds on insects, frogs, lizards, and food scraps from human dwellings, and scavenge dead fish or other dead animals; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H344.def: = bird of prey of a relatively small size, that can fly fast, but also hover; lives on rats, mice, and other birds; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H4327.def: = a group of items, such as plants or animals, sharing similar characteristics

H1772.def: exact meaning unknown, possibly: = dark brown bird with a grayish head and a long triangular tail that looks V-shaped as it maneuvers the two outer feathers; ◄ Milvus migrans; ► it feeds on insects, frogs, lizards, and food scraps from human dwellings, and scavenges dead fish and shellfish along the beaches of oceans, lakes, and rivers; they also pick off small bits of meat from animal carcasses; unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4327.def: = a group of items, such as plants or animals, sharing similar characteristics

H6158.def: = a large black bird with a thick strong beak, and fairly short legs; it is highly intelligent and seems to enjoy flying; it eats almost anything, including grain, fruit, insects, lizards, frogs, eggs, nestlings, and the meat of dead animals; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ its black color is regarded as beautiful

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3284.def: exact meaning unknown; probably: = a type of owl, large, standing over 75 centimeters (30 inches) tall; it has a pale fawn color, is spotted, has ear tufts, and is best known by its loud, deep hooting at night; it roosts by day in deep shade in acacia trees, caves, tombs, and ruined buildings; it feeds on small mammals, including hares, baby gazelles, lambs, rats and mice, and large roosting birds, especially wild and domestic ducks; ◄ Bubo bubo; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H8464.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = type of owl, medium-sized and with a brown color, but with a paler face and ear tufts that are not very prominent; it makes a strange sound like an animal or a person snoring; it lives in grassland and semi desert regions; ◄ Asio flammeus; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H7828.def: = seabird, living on the coasts of large bodies of water; white with gray or black back and upper wing surfaces; it has long flexible wings; it feeds on fish or plankton, usually settling on the water to feed; some dive into the water for their food, and many are also shoreline scavengers, eating dead fish, crabs, and shellfish; Larus ridibundus, Larus argentatus, ◄ Sterna hirundo, Sterna albifrons; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H4327.def: = a group of items, such as plants or animals, sharing similar characteristics

H5322.def: = flowers on a tree or bush

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3563.def: = small, bowl-shaped container ► used for drinking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote one's portion in life, received from God

H3244.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: type of owl with a mottled gray-brown color; its eyes are outlined with pale circles, so that it looks as though it is wearing spectacles; it prefers wooded areas or orchards and roosts close to the trunk of a tree; ◄ Strix aluco; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H8580.def: exact meaning unknown; probably: = type of owl with a very pale color, light fawn or gray on the wings and back, and almost white on the chest and under the wings; it has small eyes, a large head for its size, and a very striking heart-shaped white facial disk outlined in brown; it often roosts in barns, deserted houses, caves, and tombs; it lives mainly on rats, mice, and other small nocturnal creatures; ◄ Tyto alba; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H6893.def: exact meaning unsure: = relatively small black bird; ► unclean; ≈ associated with loneliness, devastation, destruction, and possibly death

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7360.def: = relatively small type of vulture with a long, untidy, light orange-brown feathers on its neck and head, a bare yellow face, and a yellow beak that is longer and less hooked than most vultures; the rest of the body and wings are white with black wing tips; it feeds on the scraps of carrion dropped by larger vultures, since its beak is not strong enough to tear skin and meat easily; usually scavenges scraps on beaches or rubbish dumps and eats the eggs of ground-nesting waterside birds such as plovers, sandpipers, curlews, and others, which it breaks by knocking them with a large stone; ◄ Neophron percnopterus; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H7994.def: = an eagle-like bird that feeds on fish. It has a white head, chest, and belly, with a dark brown back and wings. It has a dark stripe from the edge of the beak through the eye to the back of the neck and a faint stripe on its chest; ◄ Pandion haliaetus; it is found on seacoasts and near lakes and large rivers; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H2624.def: = large bird with long legs and a long neck; the white stork has a white body and black wings, whereas the black stork is a glossy brownish black color with a white belly; both varieties have a red beak and legs; both types spend most of the time on the ground or in shallow water searching for food; the white stork eats mainly locusts, grasshoppers, and other insects, as well as frogs, lizards, and the chicks of ground-nesting birds, whereas the black stork prefers fish and frogs but also eats the same things as the white stork; ◄ |iCiconia ciconia|i* or |iCiconia nigra|i*; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H4327.def: = a group of items, such as plants or animals, sharing similar characteristics

H601.def: = fairly large bird with a long neck, long beak, and long legs; they stand or walk slowly in shallow water in rivers, dams, ponds, or lakes looking into the water for small fish, which they catch by suddenly darting their heads into the water; they fly with slow wing-beats; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H1744.def: = bird about the size of a large dove, with a ginger colored head and body, and with wings and a tail that have black and white stripes; it has a long slender beak that curves slightly, and a long crest on its head, which it can erect into a fan shape; it has rather floppy wings and rises and falls as it flies; it spends a lot of time walking around on the ground looking for food; it eats insects and their larvae, termites, worms, small frogs, and beetles;◄ |iUpupa epops|i*; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H5847.def: = mammal with a fur skin, and slender elongated forelegs and fingers that support a flap of skin joining its fingers to its toes, which functions as a wing and allows it to fly; they fly around at night and hang upside down from trees or overhanging rocks during the day; also found in caves, tombs, unoccupied houses, and old ruins; ◄ classified as a bird by ancient Israelites because of its ability to fly; ► unclean; ≈ associated with death, desolation, destruction, and witchcraft

H2931.def: = state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H2889.def: = state in which an object is free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H5038.def: = the dead body of humans or animals

H1616.def: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker classes within the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the widows, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H4376.def: = causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

H5237.def: = state in which something or someone is identified as different or strange from one's own perspective

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1310.def: = process by which food is getting ready for consumption by being immersed in boiling water for a prolonged period

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H2461.def: = white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well-being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H4643.def: = state in which an entity is one out of ten equal parts

H1715.def: = seeds of cultivated cereal; ► used as food

H8492.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of newly harvested grapes and possibly still at the beginning of the fermentation process; ► used as beverage and for sacrifice; ≈ represents the entire range of agricultural products in Israel, together with grain and oil; associated with joy and well-being, and only once with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H3323.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food and in various religious rituals

H1060.def: = first offspring of any female; ► in the case of humans, the main heir of estate and blessing

H1241.def: = large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3925.def: = process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H6696.def: = causative action by which humans attach one or more objects to another object that contains an opening ► in order to block entry and/or exit

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

22.gl: to hold, carry, have (in one's luggage)

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H183.def: = state in which humans sense a physical craving for food or alcoholic drinks; this desire is associated with one's {L:נֶפֶשׁ<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>} ≈ and can be both good and evil

H1241.def: = large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H7941.def: = alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H3881.def: = man and tribe; ◄ third son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, later responsible for temple duties

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2506.def: = one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H7969.def: = state in which a countable entity is three in number

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4643.def: = state in which an entity is one out of ten equal parts

H5117.def: = action by which humans or animals stop their current or regular activities, ► often with the purpose of recovering their strength

H3881.def: = man and tribe; ◄ third son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, later responsible for temple duties

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2506.def: = one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H1616.def: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker classes within the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the widows, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H490.def: = woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
